definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to carry on one's shoulder or back/burden/responsibility
Holland/the Netherlands/abbr. for 荷蘭|荷兰[He2 lan2]

sentences.english: The robot and I went into the computer room but Hee -Haw stayed outside.
sentences.chinese: 机器人和我进了电脑室，但“嘻嗬”留在外面。

sentences.english: Oh, if that's case, what should we stand here waiting for?
sentences.chinese: 嗬，既然这样，我们干吗站在这里？
小孩子嗬嗬做声表示称心满意。
小孩子嗬嗬做声表示称心满意。

sentences.english: Ha, you used the word perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 嗬，这个词用得够地道啊。

sentences.english: Huh, it is really great of you not to forget to learn Chinese even though you are so hungry.
sentences.chinese: 嗬，真是不容易啊，都饿成这样了还不忘学汉语，好。

sentences.english: But love hate on for now I know thy mind.
sentences.chinese: 但，爱嗬，尽管憎吧，我已猜透你。

sentences.english: Oh, you do know this idiom?
sentences.chinese: 嗬，你知道这成语什么意思吗？

sentences.english: But there are times when a critic truly risks something and that isin the discovery and defense of the new.
sentences.chinese: 但有时评论家真正需要冒险的是发现和嗬护新生事物。

sentences.english: Well, speak of the devil, here's old Johnson.
sentences.chinese: 嗬，说鬼鬼到，老约翰逊来了。

sentences.english: But be careful not to step on the hoya .
sentences.chinese: 酋长说，“但是小心，别踩在嗬呀上。”

sentences.english: I sat on Hee-Haw's back as the donkey walked on.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在“嘻嗬”的背上，驴子继续往前走。

sentences.english: Hee-Haw sat on him while I did it.
sentences.chinese: 我绑的时候“嘻嗬”坐在他身上。

definition: (onom.) expressing admiration or surprise/sound of a laugh
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
